contentrichtext.text: {| style="float:right;" |{{wiktionary}} |- |__TOC__ |} '''Candida''' may refer to: == Biology == * [[Candida (fungus)]], a genus of yeasts * [[Malvasia Candida]], a variety of grape {{SpeciesAbbreviation|candida}} == Places == * [[Candida, Campania]], a ''comune'' in the province of Avellino, Italy * [[Candida Casa]], a church established by St Ninian at Whithorn, Dumfries and Galloway, Scotland * [[Aguas Cándidas]], a municipality located in the province of Burgos, Castile and León, Spain == Music == * [[Candida (album)|''Candida'' (album)]], by Dawn ** [[Candida (song)|"Candida" (song)]], the title track * [[Overture to Candide|Overture to ''Candide'']], an operatic overture == Theatre, film and performing arts == * ''[[Cándida]]'', a 1939 Argentine musical film drama directed by Luis Bayon Herrera * [[Candida (play)|''Candida'' (play)]], by George Bernard Shaw * Candida, a character on the television series ''[[Phil of the Future]]'' * ''Candida'', a 2006 Spanish film by [[Javier Fesser]] * "[[Candida Esperanzada]]", an episode of the Mexican series ''Mujeres Asesinas'' * ''[[Cándida, la mujer del año]]'', a 1943 Argentine comedy film * ''[[Cándida millonaria]]'', a 1941 Argentine film * ''[[Los Celos de Cándida]]'', a 1940 Argentine comedy film ==People== * [[Candida (given name)]] * [[Aldoino Filangieri di Candida]] (died 1283), nobleman in the Kingdom of Naples * [[Candida Maria de Jesus]], Spanish nun and saint == Other == * [[Candida (typeface)]] * [[Candida control diet]], a diet used to find problems with digestion * [[SS Empire Candida|SS ''Empire Candida'']], a cargo ship == See also == * ''[[Candide]]'', a 1759 satirical novel by Voltaire * [[Candidus (disambiguation)]] * [[Candidiasis]] {{disambiguation}}
